p: Colony duration is expected to be shorter in Greece than in the Czech Republic, because the climate in Greece is warmer than in the Czech Republic. This is commonly known, but is further confirmed by Fig. 4, where 10-year averages (± SDs) of monthly temperatures are plotted for Eleftheroupoli in Greece, which is close to Néa Péramos (as a representative of the Mediterranean climate see, e.g., https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mediterranean_climate), and for České Budějovice, which is one of the Czech sites. The average monthly temperatures for the other Czech site, Plzeň are almost exactly the same as those for České Budějovice and therefore are not presented here.
